 https://calendly.com/g-heron
Please Note:
 This is a permanent role. This role is for Finnish residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in Finland with no restrictions. Some of our roles 
may
 be subject to successful background/security checks.
If this wasn't exactly the role you were looking for, please apply to this role anyway, just highlight what you are looking for, apply with your CV with a brief overview of what you are looking for (The role, top 3 techs, location, salary).
I will call you to discuss your skill-set further, there may be other roles I am working on that you may be suited for.
I specialise in Mobile, Web and Cloud (AWS) recruitment here at Jefferson Frank International, focusing on the placement of highly-skilled candidates in various IT positions (Engineers, Analysts, Architects, Consultants, Project Managers, Management etc.).
We are the only global recruitment agency dedicated solely to AWS technology. Jefferson Frank is the AWS recruitment agency of choice. Whether it's a contract, permanent or remote position, we find great people great jobs.

As a member of the Kubernetes product team, you will build the operators and addons; the former, offering complete lifecycle management of mission-critical components, and the latter, a zero-ops experience for seamlessly integrating projects into your Kubernetes.
You will gain familiarity with the latest features in Kubernetes and look to incorporate the best of open-source to bring functionality to our end-users. You will collaborate with industry peers and partners to bring the right solutions to our customers.
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Python, Golang and Kubernetes. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu.
What you'll do
Write high-quality code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with a vibrant community
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Who you are
You are a Python programmer with interest or experience in Golang
You have experience with Kubernetes
You have strong written and verbal communication skills
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You love technology and working with brilliant people
Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
#Stack

Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We're innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time - even when it's cloudy or dark - providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
To support the company's growth, we continue to scale our Satellite Communications Network team and are looking for a Software Engineer to join us in the Helsinki area, Finland. ICEYE Satellite Communications Network is responsible for creating high reliability and high throughput communication between the ground systems and the satellites in ICEYE fleet globally. Various teams are working on contact planning and configuration, TT&C chain, payload downlinking and ground station infrastructure around it.
About the role?
As a Senior Go Engineer, you will work for the Payload Downlink team. You are an experienced software engineer - especially with Go but also other languages - who creates, maintains and improves our payload downlinking system, which includes payload data receiving, decoding, decrypting service, data aggregation and monitoring around it. In addition to programming with Go, you will need fundamental skills with maintaining and developing the infrastructure around this service with tools such as Terraform and Helm, where you are assisted with the DevOps team.
You will be developing new features, as well as new software from scratch, to make modular and extensible systems, highly available and horizontally scalable. You will help design and implement all layers of it, and also provide APIs to internal stakeholders. Your target stack is for the most part Go services running on Kubernetes, and we do a lot of our own DevOps with infrastructure as code, be it Kubernetes manifests, Terraform infrastructure or directly interacting with cloud provider SDKs. We follow an agile process, aim at best practices, and are always willing to improve. You are accountable for your work and can show your results, with good quality monitoring metrics and actionable performance.
We are looking for a senior level software engineer, where you are required to be experienced on technical level and match the criteria. In addition, "senior" title requires an ability to take ownership and have accountability of certain software products which you will help design and implement, and help your co-workers with a positive and talented example.
Requirements
What you will do:
Developing our payload downlinking chain currently written with Go and some components with C with the flavor of other supporting languages, tools and frameworks.
You are familiar with the Kubernetes running on top of cloud infrastructure, as the work requires maintaining and improve infrastructure around the service
Following and promoting our agile processes, provide feedback and help to continuously improve them.
Keeping your development skills up to date with recent trends and best practices. 
For senior candidates; Taking ownership of relevant products, gathering feedback from users and creating plans to incorporate it.
What you need to succeed:
You have software/data engineering professional experience, including contributions to making infrastructure decisions. For senior candidates, we require examples of the positive impact and solid engineering discipline.
A solid hands-on software engineer and you can show it. You get things done, but also know when to take the time to get the design right. You can present the results and metrics about your success.
Enjoy working in a team and have the right mix of getting stuff done and having fun.
Outstanding coding skills with Go and wide experience with other languages too.
Understanding of agile software development methodologies and experience working in an agile team before.
Experience creating CI/CD pipelines as well as working with containers and orchestration. You are familiar with GitOps workflow.
Knowledge of GNU/Linux systems is essential, with shell scripting and networking a plus.
You work mostly in the high abstraction layer, but you are not afraid to jump into the lower abstraction layer to follow communication protocol implementation and work with the code written with C.
Experience working with software security, microservices, containers, AWS/cloud computing and infrastructure as code is required.
Understanding spacecraft domain is considered an advantage, but we value eagerness to learn it in case there is no prior experience
Benefits
What we offer:
A job that matters in a dynamic New Space environment with a scale-up approach
An independent role with a supportive and diverse work environment
Occupational healthcare, occupational and private insurance
A yearly benefit budget to spend as you wish (i.e. on sport, transport, wellness, lunch, etc.)
Relocation support (i.e. flight tickets, accommodation, relocation buddy program)
Time for self-development, research, training, conferences, or certification schemes
Inspiring and collaborating offices and silent workspaces enabling you to focus
Regular internal events for employees (e.g. sports events, team-building events, parties, etc.)
A wide variety of best coffee, tea, snacks, and sweets to accompany your daily space mission
Diversity & inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE. We are looking forward to receiving your application in English as soon as possible.
We are making the impossible possible together.

job_title: Azure Data engineer & Azure Data Architect
raw_text:
Our clients are looking for top talent in Finland when it comes to Data Engineers and Data Architects, focused in the Azure ecosystem.
This is a fantastic opportunity to advance your career, increase your salary, improve your benefits package and develop your skills to become the best professional possible in your field of work.
Skills & Qualifications
 Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse, Logic Apps, ETL, Data Warehousing, Architecture, Azure Cloud, Power BI
 Strong Finnish communication skills required
 Certifications desired - but not mandatory.
Benefits
 Company shares, paid certifications, salary bonus, food/travel/culture vouchers, company progression, tailored development plans, health-care, insurances, PC equipment.
Get in touch to fine out more information!

Azure Data Engineer - Helsinki
Do you want to work within a strong internal culture that gives you limitless opportunities to grow as a professional and realize your own potential?
Our client is an innovative group of experts who offer you the opportunity to complete challenging and interesting assignments utilising the latest Azure technology with colleagues who are amongst the top in the industry.
Our client focuses solely on Azure Data Warehousing/Analytics, as well as Azure Integrations, working on fascinating large projects in the private sector. Employees are always working in teams in an open and friendly environment that offers flexible working options.
Responsibilities:
 Work Full-stack with Azure technologies such as Power BI and Azure Data Factory.
 Design, implement and improve the client's data analytics solutions for their customers.
 You are involved in the whole process of projects from the design stage to the implementation stage.
 You work as part of a team building modern data platforms and data pipes in Microsoft Azure cloud environments.
What they are looking for:
 You have a few years of experience in data warehousing (e.g. ETL) or integrations, and especially in Microsoft SQL Server databases.
 In addition to technical skills, the clients expects you to have experience in teamwork in the customer interface and the ability to promote development work independently.
 They value the experience of Azure, Microsoft on-premises analytics solutions and Master Data Management,
 The desire to learn and develop into a top-class Azure expert.
 Fluency in Finnish & English
What they offer:
 Excellent salary & benefits package
 They have built a quality senior team, sourcing only the best talent across Finland to ensure a high quality output
 Always work in project teams, no fire fighting
 Completely Azure based projects in the private sector
 Outsourced boring maintenance work to ensure colleagues work on only the most interesting and effective tasks
Salary: 4500-8000EUR for the right candidate
Whilst this position offers remote working all candidates must be located inside Finland with a valid work Visa.
All interviews will be carried out remotely.

Primary location:
HELSINKI
Haluatko päästä käsiksi Suomen mielenkiintoisimpaan dataan? Onko markkinoinnin vaikuttavuuden ja tuloksellisuuden analysointi ja kehittäminen lähellä sydäntäsi? Oletko digitaalisen analytiikan seniorosaaja ja hallitset myös SQL:n hyvin? 
Mikäli vastasit kyllä, tule analyytikoksi markkinoinnin analytiikan tiimiimme! Haemme kokenutta analyytikkoa vahvalla data-analyysin ja digianalytiikan osaamisella.
Mitä tulet meillä tekemään?
Data-analyytikkona työskentelet tärkeänä osana operatiivisia markkinoinnin bränditiimejämme. Työnkuvasi ytimeen kuuluu markkinoinnin kohderyhmien suunnittelu ja monikanavaisten kampanjoiden ja markkinointiohjelmien tuloksellisuuden mittaaminen ja raportointi. Analysoit jatkuvasti kampanja-, asiakas- ja myyntidataa ja tuotat data-analyysiin pohjautuvia suosituksia markkinointiviestinnän kehittämiseksi.
Työpaikkasi sijaitsee Ässäkeskuksessa Helsingin Vallilassa. Toistaiseksi toimimme joustavasti hybridimallilla toimisto- ja etätyötä sujuvasti yhdistäen.
Onnistumisen avaimet
Tässä roolissa menestyt omaamalla analyyttista otetta ja ongelmanratkaisukykyä. Olet sinut erilaisten tutkimus- ja datalähteiden analysoinnin kanssa, ja saat jäsennettyä tiedon helposti ymmärrettävään muotoon. Kykenet muodostamaan keräämäsi datan pohjalta merkityksellisiä johtopäätöksiä ja luomaan keskustelua, jotta tiimisi kykenee jatkuvasti kehittämään markkinoinnin vaikuttavuutta ja tehokkuutta. Matemaattisesta kyvykkyydestä, tilastotieteen osaamisesta ja kokemuksesta data-analyysista ja digianalytiikan tuottaman datan analysoinnista on tehtävässä hyötyä. Hallitset SQL-kielen hyvin ja omaat kokemusta datavisualisoinnin työkaluista kuten PowerBI:stä, joita käytät päivittäin osana työkalupakkiasi.
Parhaan taustan tähän tehtävään antaa alan ylempi korkeakoulututkinto ja kokemus toimimisesta vastaavissa tehtävissä markkinoinnin analytiikan tai konsultoinnin parissa. Tehtävässä menestyminen edellyttää myös sujuvaa suomen ja englannin kielen taitoa.
Uskomme, että viihdyt meillä, jos olet kehitysorientoitunut ja oppimishaluinen sekä työskentelyotteeltasi ratkaisukeskeinen ja aikaansaava. Pääset työssäsi liikkeelle silloinkin, kun asiat eivät ole yksiselitteisesti jäsenneltyjä, ja omaat hyvät vuorovaikutustaidot sekä halun puhaltaa tiimin kanssa yhteen hiileen.
Mitä meillä on tarjota sinulle?
Tarjoamme sinulle monipuolisen tehtäväkokonaisuuden S-ryhmän brändien kehittämisen parissa sekä mahdollisuuden olla vaikuttamassa brändien tulevaisuuteen. Työmme lopputuloksilla on aidosti vaikutusta suomalaisten arkeen. Haluamme jatkuvasti kehittyä, joten pääset kehittämään brändien lisäksi myös toimintaamme ja omaa osaamistasi. Saat tukea työhösi muilta markkinointiyksikkömme analyytikoilta, tutkimusasiantuntijoilta ja analytiikan asiantuntijoilta. S-ryhmä tarjoaa myös laajat mahdollisuudet kehittyä urallasi niin asiantuntija-, kehitys- kuin esihenkilötehtävissä.
Lisäksi
Saat käyttöösi Suomen laajimmat henkilöstöedut
Tarjoamme hyvinvointi- ja vapaa-ajan edut, mm. ePassi 200 € vuodessa, maksuton kuntosali Ässäkeskuksella ja lakisääteistä kattavampi työterveyshuolto
Hyvästä ja tuloksellisesta tekemistä palkitaan, ja meillä jokainen työntekijä onkin tulospalkkauksen piirissä
Tule työkaveriksemme! 
Tähän tehtävään voit hakea oheisen hakulomakkeen kautta 
5
.11.2023 mennessä
.
Lisätietoja antaa Head of Marketing Analytics, Jari Salojuuri. Jarin tavoitat parhaiten puhelimitse 23.10. klo 9:30-10:00 välillä numerosta 0503041610 tai sähköpostitse osoitteesta jari.salojuuri@sok.fi
#SOK

Do you want to work within a strong internal culture that gives you limitless opportunities to grow as a professional and realize your own potential?
Our client is an innovative group of experts who offer you the opportunity to complete challenging and interesting assignments utilising the latest Azure technology with colleagues who are amongst the top in the industry.
Our client focuses solely on Azure Data Warehousing/Analytics, as well as Azure Integrations, working on fascinating large projects in the private sector. Employees are always working in teams in an open and friendly environment that offers flexible working options.
Responsibilities:
 Work Full-stack with Azure technologies such as Power BI and Azure Data Factory.
 Design, implement and improve the client's data analytics solutions for their customers.
 You are involved in the whole process of projects from the design stage to the implementation stage.
 You work as part of a team building modern data platforms and data pipes in Microsoft Azure cloud environments.
What they are looking for:
 You have a few years of experience in data warehousing (e.g. ETL) or integrations, and especially in Microsoft SQL Server databases.
 In addition to technical skills, the clients expects you to have experience in teamwork in the customer interface and the ability to promote development work independently.
 They value the experience of Azure, Microsoft on-premises analytics solutions and Master Data Management,
 The desire to learn and develop into a top-class Azure expert.
 Fluency in Finnish & English
What they offer:
 Excellent salary & benefits package
 They have built a quality senior team, sourcing only the best talent across Finland to ensure a high quality output
 Always work in project teams, no fire fighting
 Completely Azure based projects in the private sector
 Outsourced boring maintenance work to ensure colleagues work on only the most interesting and effective tasks
Salary: 4500-8000EUR for the right candidate
Whilst this position offers remote working all candidates must be located inside Finland with a valid work Visa.
All interviews will be carried out remotely.

Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international New Space company with employees from more than 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We're innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Being advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity, and we know how to have fun!
What do we do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time - even when it's cloudy or dark - providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
About the role?
As a System Engineer (Kubernetes), your job is to make sure that our on-premise Kubernetes clusters and products running on it are configured and maintained so that downtime is minimized, security is ensured and SLAs are met.
For example, a customer might want to utilize their own existing ground station network to have the data downlinked to and processed on-premise. How do we ensure fast recovery from incidents and efficient monitoring? How do we configure the different layers of the software stack so they are resilient and highly available? How do we make sure that customer data is safe at any time? These are the kinds of questions that you will help to answer and then, together with the product software teams, deliver and maintain the system at the customer site.
Responsibilities:
Installation, configuration, maintenance and administration of production-grade Kubernetes clusters.
Automation of deployments on the services level - GitOps approach.
Participate in designing, implementing, and maintaining our on-premise products.
Response and management of production incidents.
Work with the customers to form a mutual understanding of their needs, capabilities and constraints.
Collaborate with Product Managers and Engineers (mostly Software Engineers) to build the features that this customer needs in our product.
Work with our customer deliveries team to make sure that the system gets delivered and will be maintained.
These deliveries require you to be very hands-on, e.g. running demos and pilots to meet customer requirements and cooperating with customer's technical teams, ensuring a successful deployment.
Right now, you will be one of the first people to take this role in our company. As our business grows, you have the opportunity to affect the role and processes used.
Requirements
Strong expertise in maintenance and administration of production-grade Kubernetes clusters.
Expertise in DevOps and CI/CD implementation (deployments automation).
Experience with Linux system administration in production.
Understanding of microservice design and architectural patterns.
Experience in coding/scripting for automation ("Infrastructure as Code" -mindset).
Experience with Configuration Management / Deployment tools.
Experience with orchestration tools - e.g. Hashicorp Terraform, Packer, Ansible.
Experience with logging and monitoring solutions.
Emphasis on security in your actions.
Readiness to occasionally visit customer premises around the world.
Ability to learn quickly in both technical and business domains in an ever-evolving startup environment.
Strong English communication skills (our company's official language is English).
Ability to explain issues clearly and concisely and establish effective working relationships in a distributed team.
Ability to multitask, shift gears quickly, work independently and collaboratively, adapt easily to shifting priorities, process changes, and schedule changes.
Readiness to participate in an on-call rotation providing 24-hour, 7-day support and off-hours maintenance windows
Preferred skills and experience:
Being Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) will be a plus.
Hands-on experience with VMWare virtualization.
Good general understanding of software development practices (e.g. The Twelve Factor App).
Quality Assurance skills.
A background in earth observation, satellites or ground stations.
Experience with Storage arrays administration.
Experience with VMware vSAN administration.
Experience with cabling for industrial/rugged deployments.
Experience with networks administration and common network protocols will be a plus.
Benefits
What we offer:
A job that matters in a dynamic New Space environment with a scale-up approach
An independent role with a supportive and diverse work environment
Occupational healthcare, occupational and private insurance
A yearly benefit budget to spend as you wish (i.e. on sport, transport, wellness, lunch, etc.)
Relocation support (i.e. flight tickets, accommodation, relocation buddy program)
Time for self-development, research, training, conferences, or certification schemes
Inspiring and collaborating offices and silent workspaces enabling you to focus
Regular internal events for employees (e.g. sports events, team-building events, parties, etc.)
A wide variety of best coffee, tea, snacks, and sweets to accompany your daily space mission
Diversity & inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with ICEYE. We are looking forward to receiving your application in English as soon as possible.
We are making the impossible possible together.

job_title: 4 Data Engineeriä ja Cloud Data Engineer
raw_text:
Fenniassa on käynnissä historiamme suurin muutoshanke, 
Tulevaisuuden Fennia
, jonka tavoitteena on uudistaa toimintaamme vastaamaan entistäkin paremmin asiakkaidemme tulevaisuuden tarpeita. Tulevaisuuden Fenniassa data ja analytiikka ovat toimintamme peruspilareita. Jos siis koet sydämesi sykkivän datalle, analytiikan mahdollisuuksille sekä asiakkaiden elämän helpottamiselle, tutustu tehtävään alla tarkemmin ja tartu tilaisuuteen!
Haemme 
Data ja Analytiikka
 -yksikköömme 
neljää Data Engineeriä ja yhtä Cloud Data Engineeriä
. Tehtävässä vastaat nimetyn vastuuyksikkösi datoista sekä niiden kehittämisestä ja ylläpitämisestä yhdessä osaavien tiimikavereidesi ja liiketoimintayksiköiden kanssa. Varmistat, että datan ja analytiikan ratkaisut auttavat Fenniaa saavuttamaan liiketoiminnan tavoitteet ja että käytämme parhaita menetelmiä, teknologioita ja työkaluja tiedon hyödyntämisessä ja analysoinnissa.
Yhdessä
 tiimimme vastaa, että tuottamamme ratkaisut vastaavat koko Fennian liiketoiminnan tarpeisiin. 
Reilussa
 tiimissäsi työskentelee noin 10 
kehittyvää
 data-ammattilaista, joilla on osaamista datan kehittämisen eri alueilla. 
Rohkeat
 liiketoimintayksiköt ovat parhaita ystäviämme, joten pääset tekemään tiivistä yhteistyötä liiketoiminnan kehittämisessä datan asiantuntijana. Yhteisenä tavoitteenamme on saada datasta ja analytiikasta kaikki hyöty asiakkaidemme yrittämistä ja elämää varten.
Sinulta odotamme:
Toivomme, että sinulla on kokemusta tietovaraston kehittämisestä, mallintamisesta, ylläpidosta ja ajojen orkestroinnista, sekä 
SQL
:n käytöstä. Sinulla on huolellinen työskentelyote, koska datan laatu ja eheys on meille tärkeää ja sääntelynmukaisuus ohjaa toimintaamme. Työskentelemme suomeksi ja englanniksi, joten molempien osaaminen on tarpeen.
Lisäksi arvostamme:
Kokemusta tietokannoista
Jonkin ETL-työkalun tuntemusta
Kokemusta kyselyjen suorituskykyjen optimoinnista
Kokemusta versionhallinnasta, sillä työmme versioidaan
Vakuutusliiketoiminnan tuntemusta
Ymmärrystä pilviteknologioista 
Cloud Data Engineerin tehtävässä eduksi on myös kokemus datan kehittämisestä AWS:ssä, Pythonin osaaminen sekä kokemus API:en kehittämisestä.
Me Fenniassa uskomme, että halulla oppia jatkuvasti uutta pärjää pitkälle. Joten jos tuntuu, että olisit kiinnostunut, mutta jotain vaatimuksia jää täyttämättä, niin ei haittaa. Hakemusta vain sisälle niin jutellaan. Meillä menestyy innovatiivinen henkilö, joka nauttii uusien tiedolla johtamisen ratkaisujen keksimisestä vakuutustoiminnan tarpeisiin.
Miksi sinun kannattaa tarttua tilaisuuteen?
Data ja sen kehittäminen on keskeinen osa Fennian strategiaa, joten meillä pääset merkittävään rooliin tiedolla johdetussa vakuutusyhtiössä. Pääset kehittämään, vaikuttamaan ja hyödyntämään osaamistasi laajasti. Työyhteisömme on ammattitaitoinen ja motivoitunut. Fennian arvoihin oletkin jo tutustunut, jos luit ilmoituksen tarkasti. Ne ovat Yhdessä, Reilu, Vastuullisesti rohkea ja Kehittyvä.
Tarjoamme vakituisen työtehtävän vakavaraisessa ja vahvan perustan omaavassa vakuutusalan konsernissa, jossa vallitsee edistämisen kulttuuri. Kattavan perehdytyksen lisäksi rohkaisemme työntekijöitämme jatkuvaan itsensä kehittämiseen ja tarjoammekin aktiivisesti mahdollisuuksia lisäkoulutukseen. Näin mahdollistamme sinulle kehittyvän tehtäväkentän ja mielekkäät työtehtävät
Tulet työskentelemään hyvien kulkuyhteyksien varrella Triplan läheisyydessä Länsi-Pasilassa. Arkea sujuvoittavat liukuva työaika ja mahdollisuus etätyöhön. Koemme, että työhyvinvoinnista huolehtiminen on tärkeämpää kuin koskaan ennen
,
 ja tuemme henkilöstömme hyvinvointia mm. liikunta-, pyörä- ja vakuutuseduin. Tavoitteenamme on, että jokainen fennialainen voi yhdistää työn ja vapaa-ajan hyvinvointia maksimoivalla tavalla.
Kiinnostuitko tehtävästä? Hae siis nyt!
Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa 
Cloud Data Platform Manager Juha Järvi
, jonka tavoitat parhaiten keskiviikkoisin klo 12-13 numerosta 040 178 4629.
Pyrimme löytämään sopivat henkilöt mahdollisimman pian, joten hakemus kannattaa jättää heti. Haethan kuitenkin 
viimeistään 30.11
. Haastattelemme hakijoita jo hakuaikana ja myös valintoja voidaan tehdä ennen hakuajan päättymistä.
Toimintamme Fennialla perustuu vastuullisuuteen ja luottamukseen, joten vakituiseen ja pitkään määräaikaiseen työsuhteeseen tulevalle teetetään työhöntulotarkastus, johon sisältyy huumausainetesti.
Fennia arvostaa yhdenvertaisuutta ja monimuotoisuutta työyhteisössä. Meille ovat tervetulleita kaikki hakijat taustoista, iästä, sukupuolesta ja eri kieli-, kulttuuri- ja vähemmistöryhmistä riippumatta.

As a key member of our Automation & Software organization, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence solutions for glass processing machinery. Your work will directly contribute to the development of innovative products and services that leverage AI to solve complex problems and enhance user experiences.
You will be working in a cross-functional setup and cooperate with other software engineers and quality assurance engineers, as well as, with various internal stakeholders. As a Software Engineer, you ensure agreed content and quality are successfully delivered on time and cost. Moreover, you help your team to deliver on its goals by solving complex real-world engineering problems in your daily work. You can communicate effectively when analyzing, troubleshooting, and resolving issues together with other developers and stakeholders.
This Is What Your Work Is About
Create and implement ML/AI algorithms to solve specific business problems
Collect, clean, and preprocess data for model training
Train and fine-tune ML models for optimal performance
Optimize models for scalability and efficiency
Stay updated on AI/ML advancements and apply them
Rigorously test and validate models
Ensure continued functionality of our application during maintenance and deployment of software
This Is Your Preferred Background
Proven experience in developing and implementing machine learning algorithms and AI solutions. Experience with deep learning, neural networks, and natural language processing is a plus
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
Strong understanding of data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation
Solid knowledge of software engineering principles and best practices
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker)
Strong communication skills in English to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
MSc. or BSc. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, AI, or a related field.
For more information please contact Olli Lehtinen, Senior Development Manager, Automation, olli.lehtinen@glaston.net or tel. +358505722457. Please apply by 6.10.2023.

job_title: Software Engineer - Python - Ubuntu Pro client - graduate level
raw_text:
Ubuntu Pro is a suite of specialist services provided by Canonical. Whether for enterprise customers deploying systems at scale or users who want security patching for their personal Ubuntu LTS at home, the Ubuntu Pro Client is the command-line tool that manages all these services.
The quality and stability of the Ubuntu Pro Client is critically important, since it comes pre-installed on every Ubuntu system. You'll work with the Ubuntu Server team, alongside major cloud partners and multiple Canonical product teams to develop, test and release improvements to the Pro client. You will also be a voice in communication with our users, ensuring their needs are met.
This role requires quality-oriented software engineering in Python and a focus on software interoperability over a vast range of target releases and environments. Excellent Python skills are a key requirement, with previous contributions to open source Python projects being an advantage. The Pro client often interacts with the Ubuntu package management; therefore, experience in configuring apt, and knowledge of deb packaging and general system administration is advantageous in this role.
Applicants should be passionate about the Ubuntu project and its values and about building tools that are used by millions of people around the world. A personal interest and emphasis on quality, thinking of edge cases, ease of use, documentation, and careful community coordination is important. The Pro client is used at all ranges, from mission-critical environments to hobbyist Ubuntu users; applicants should be ready to work with the whole spectrum of end users and help guide engineering best practices with all of them in mind.
What you'll do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality code, with unit and functional tests, to create new features
Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
Review code produced by other engineers
Discuss ideas and investigate to find good solutions
Work from home, with global travel 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events
Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have extensive experience with Python on Linux
You have interest in and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux systems administration, continuous integration, end-system contract management, Debian packaging, working with public or on premise clouds
Bonus points if you have experience engaging with the open source community
Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.
#stack

a Senior Cloud Security Engineer

Your key skills:

Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. We are triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services, and we are recognized as a 'Visionary' by Gartner for Public Cloud IT Services. job_title: Software Development Engineer II, Data Platform
raw_text:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 3.9 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security, and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs, and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers.
What You’ll Do
Mapbox is looking for an experienced engineer to help grow the foundation of our platform. The Data Platform team owns, maintains and builds crucial services that Mapbox relies upon. We provide reliable and scalable ingestion, processing, warehousing and orchestration solutions.
In This Role, You Can Expect To
You will be responsible for contributing to, operating, and improving all things related to our data platform.
Support internal customers of the data platform by building infrastructure and tooling to address their needs 
Work on our ingestion systems that ingest terabytes of data a day 
Simplify and strengthen Mapbox’s processes and tools for designing, deploying, and monitoring data processing and querying workloads on AWS
Contribute to our data processing systems that launch thousands of EMR clusters a day and add to our data lake at petabyte scale 
Promote a culture of operational excellence by meticulously testing and monitoring our systems and code, and being on-call to support the health of our services
Design systems and make decisions that will keep pace with the rapid growth of Mapbox
Document your work and decision-making processes, and lead presentations and discussions in a way that is easy for others to understand
Uphold a culture of collaboration, transparency, creativity, inclusion, and data-driven decisions
What We Believe Are Important Traits For This Role
Proven ability to design and develop sophisticated, efficient, and durable infrastructure on AWS 
Experience with our tech stack (Spark, Airflow, Python and/or node.js, Docker, AWS and Snowflake)
Experience with Kubernetes is a plus 
Experience with distributed systems at scale
Track record of building self-service and high-quality tools for developers with a customer-driven mindset
A desire to share your expertise through documentation, mentorship, and both written and vocal discussion
A desire to work with individuals with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences
Autonomy and proactivity around driving work to completion in the face of ambiguity
What We Value
In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:
We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.
We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.
We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.
We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.
By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you agree to the 
Mapbox Privacy Policy
 which is linked here.
Mapbox is an EEO Employer - Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

job_title: Senior Python Backend Engineers, Courier Group
raw_text:
Job Description
Are you interested in being part of building a service that is unique to the tastes of our over 20 million users? Would you like to be in the midst of it all, learning, growing, and expanding into new verticals together with us? Does working with Python and Machine Learning and building things from scratch sound like something you’d like to do? If the answers to all 3 questions are “yes”, then great news since Wolt is looking for Python Backend Engineers to join different engineering teams across our Courier Group!
Depending on your interests and experience we’d love to welcome you to one of the following teams in the Courier Group:
The Logistics Estimation Team
 lies in one of the more complex parts of Wolt’s business - the logistics. This is because our logistics platform is responsible for courier task allocation and estimating delivery estimates that our customers, couriers, and merchants see. So, naturally, having a more efficient logistics platform would benefit everyone in our ecosystem: our Courier Partners, our merchants, and our customers. In this role you will be working closely with other backend engineers and data scientists as well as UX designers and frontend engineers who are working on quite a few interesting solutions. For one, right now we’re developing and deploying machine learning models for estimating different parts of the delivery process as well as designing and running experiments to evaluate their performance.
The Courier Earnings Team
 - courier compensation is a core and mission critical domain for Wolt, as it's easy for everyone to imagine what will happen to the business immediately if couriers are not paid correctly and on time. The Courier Earnings team's mission involves building the platform and tooling that allows Wolt to accurately and fairly reward couriers for their time and effort, while at the same time keeping the customer experience at the highest level. The team consists of several backend engineers working with Python and Scala as well as web and app developers, UX designers and data scientists. We're working on exciting and fundamental changes to the platform to make pricing decisions more dynamic, data driven and automated. All of this requires a lot of design, software engineering, data science and product excellence, and this is where you’d come in!
As a backend engineer in these teams you will have a big impact on and be a key player in building new estimate, forecast or dynamic pricing services from scratch, figuring out better ways to run Woltwide consumer-facing A/B tests, as well as helping our data scientists integrate their new ML-based models into our Python backend, and, of course, learning new things from your teammates along the way.
So, if you’re an experienced Python engineer with a background in machine learning or similar field (e.g. data science), an interest in tackling scalability challenges, and building some real cool stuff, then be sure to drop us a line. Also, you’ll get a chance to work closely together with our brilliant data scientists (seriously, this is a great chance to learn a lot about data science if you have a knack for it)!
📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland or Sweden.
Our humble expectations
👉 You have fluent programing skills using modern Python, have experience setting up backend microservices, and building solid scalable services and well-structured applications using it.
👉 You have experience working with machine learning or similar computational methods
👉 You have experience working with Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration as well as familiarity with database technologies, such as PostgreSQL.
👉 You have an analytical and curious way of thinking and are comfortable working with real-world data and its different nuances
👉 Since the backend has mostly been written in Python (ofc) and Scala, if you have previous experience and willingness to tinker in the backend with Scala - even better, we consider that a plus!
👉 Most importantly, you’re a dedicated person who is pragmatic with a positive attitude, who doesn't shy away from going outside of their comfort zone, and demonstrates curiosity and willingness to keep continuously learning.
Next Steps
The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
💯 Overall our product organization consists of a team of over 700 people at Wolt. We aim to build none other than the best-in-the-world engineering team here.
💙 You’ll get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognise that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind, and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement.
🙌 Join us for an exciting journey! The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Lina Muncyte (name.surname(at)wolt.com).
About Wolt
Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
Working in Product Development at Wolt
At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
Join us today to build Wolt together.
_1

Wanted: We are looking for a Senior software engineer ready and excited to take on the challenge of making Upright's Net Impact Platform the #1 impact data platform globally. The Upright Platform is currently used by 200+ institutional investment organizations and corporations, mainly in Europe and North America. We are now looking for exceptional software engineers to join our platform team and help us take our net impact platform to the next level.
The platform team is responsible for developing Upright's data analytics platform, including both its customer-facing side and internal tools. The team plans, develops and maintains the platform and they also own monitoring and performance metrics. One continuous goal for the team is to make the platform understandable and user-friendly from a layperson’s point of view. The frontend is built with React and the backend in Node, both using TypeScript.
The platform team is currently a compact team of three full-stack software engineers plus a team lead working in an autonomous and proactive manner, taking ownership when tackling development tasks. The team works in an agile fashion, following weekly sprints, and collaborating actively with the data team to get features implemented.
Your exact role in the team will be tailored together during the recruiting process based on your background, experience, skill level, and interests. In general, software development tasks range from the usual bug fixes and implementation of new features, to developing novel algorithms for our net impact model, improving technical infrastructure, or setting up Python microservices to take machine learning solutions to production, amongst others.
SIGNS FOR BEING A GREAT MATCH WITH THIS ROLE INCLUDE:
Solid track record of internal passion for excellence: you have gotten things done clearly better than what was required/expected from you, as you enjoy doing things well
Sense of urgency and drive to get the job done with tight deadlines
Attention to both the essence as well as details of technical design
Experience in relevant technologies, such as Typescript/Javascript, Node, React, PostgreSQL, Docker, and general web technology design principles. (You don't need to have experience in the exact Upright stack, but you should have enough relevant experience to be able to learn any missing parts quickly.)
Understanding of the whole software lifecycle including design, development, deployment and operations
Ability to think analytically, structure your work, and solve problems proactively
Ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team that includes technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to communicate clearly both verbally and in writing
ADDITIONALLY, WE VALUE THE FOLLOWING QUALIFICATIONS:
Deep experience of developing distributed, data-intensive software products
Experience working with machine learning technologies
Experience with Docker, Elasticsearch, AWS Cloudfront, AWS S3
Experience programming in Python (including the usual numerical libraries)
Proficiency in designing user interfaces and UX
WHAT WE OFFER:
A chance to join a quickly growing and highly ambitious impact SaaS company with a mission that matters
A fun and kind team with exceptional people who care about what they do
Exciting professional growth opportunities
Competitive compensation, including stock options and a comprehensive healthcare package
MISSION THAT MATTERS
Upright is on a mission to incentivize companies to optimize their net impact by enabling science-based decision-making for investors, customers, employees, and public sector agents. To do that, Upright develops a proprietary data model based on an open-access database of 200M+ scientific articles and artificial intelligence to quantify the net impact of companies on people, planet, society, and knowledge creation. In addition to net impact, Upright produces data on UN SDG alignment, EU taxonomy, and EU SFDR PAI indicators. Currently, our impact data platform is used by 200+ institutional investors and companies, such as Nasdaq, Nordea, Royal Bank of Canada, EQT and Nokia.
Deadline And Who To Contact
Candidates are reviewed on a continuous basis and the role will be filled when the right person is found. If the post is still online, it means we haven't yet found our perfect match :)
If you have any specific questions about the role, you can contact our recruiting coordinator Sonja Rajala via email sonja.rajala@uprightproject.com.

Tuotamme peleillä iloa ja suojelemme sitä. Haluamme, että suomalaisten pelaaminen pysyy ilon puolella. Tässä työssä vastuullisuus ohjaa kaikkea toimintaamme. Haluamme olla pelialan edelläkävijä ja vastuullisen pelaajakokemuksen suunnannäyttäjä. Hyvinvointi on meille sydämen asia. On tärkeää, että töihin on mukava tulla joka päivä. Meillä on monipuoliset ja laajat työsuhde-edut. Tarjoamme vaikuttavia työtehtäviä kehittyvässä työyhteisössä, jossa on iloinen tekemisen meininki. 
Tehdään työtä ‒ yhdessä ilon puolella.
Näkemyksellinen Data Engineer
Miltä kuulostaisi päästä vaikuttamaan siihen, miten Suomen suurimman verkkokaupan tiedoista, yhden Suomen suurimman suomalaisen asiakaskannan sisällöstä sekä valtavasta määrästä pelitapahtumien dataa luodaan vankkaa perustaa tiedolla johtamiseen?
Etsimmekin nyt kokenutta Data Engineer:iä tuomaan osaamista ja näkemyksellisyyttä noin 20 hengen 
Data and Information Management -tiimiimme
, joka on osa Veikkauksen yli 300 henkistä TECH-toimintoa.
Työpäiviimme
 kuuluu olemassa olevien prosessin ylläpitoa, uusien rakentamista ja toimintamme kehittämistä niin teknologiaratkaisujen kuin toimintatapojen kautta. Tässä roolissa korostuvat odotukset koko tiimin toimintamallien ja työkalujen kehittämisestä, muutoksien jalkauttamisesta, päivittäisten työn rutiinien ohjauksesta, kollegoiden auttamisesta puhumattakaan. Työnkuvaa tarkennetaan hyvän tyypin vahvuuksien mukaan.
Tiimimme tehtäväkenttä 
Veikkauksella on laaja, alkaen erilaisten rajapintojen kautta tapahtuvien datojen integroinnista, transformaatiosta ja datan varastoinnista aina datan tarjoilemiseen analytiikan sekä muiden ratkaisujen kautta. Isoin työkenttämme on operatiivisessa ETL/ELT-tekemisessä ja kehityspuolella tulevaisuuden data-alustan suunnittelussa ja toteutuksessa sekä toimintamme tehostamisessa.
Tällä hetkellä tärkeimmät työkalumme ja teknologiamme
 ovat Kafka, Nifi, Pentaho (PDI), Vertica, ja GCP natiiviratkaisuineen. Emme kuitenkaan edellytä juuri näiden osaamista, sillä uskomme, että kokemuksesi auttaa sinua omaksumaan ne riittävän hyvin. Koska olemme siirtämässä tekemistämme pilveen, arvostamme pilviympäristöissä jo kertynyttä kokemustasi.
Tämä Tehtävä On Sinulle, Jos
Sinulla on vahva motivaatio kehittää toimintamalleja
Sinulla on usean vuoden työkokemuksen tuottamaa näkemystä vaativasta datan käsittelystä ja sen kehittämisestä
Ketterät menetelmät ovat tuttuja ja ymmärrät niiden arvon
Arvostat pitkäjänteistä kehitystyötä ja ymmärrät jatkuvan parantamisen merkityksen
Olet tiimipelaaja ja kommunikoit sujuvasti suomeksi ja englanniksi eri sidosryhmien kanssa
Me Puolestamme Voimme Tarjota Sinulle
Näköalapaikan modernien ja kehittyvien teknologioiden parissa rahapelitoiminnassa
Mahdollisuuden pitkäjänteiseen datatekemiseen ilman jatkuvaa toimitusprojektien deadline-painetta hartioilla
Työpaikan Veikkauksen pääkonttorilla Pohjois-Haagassa yhdistettynä joustaviin hybridityön käytäntöihin, eli saat parhaat puolet molemmista tavoista
Matkassamme pääset kasvamaan ammattilaisena.
 Haluamme aidosti olla vastuullinen työnantaja, joka tarjoaa mielekkäitä työtehtäviä, kilpailukykyiset työsuhde-edut sekä pitää huolta työn ja vapaa-ajan tasapainosta. Voit lukea meistä, eduistamme ja työkulttuuristamme lisää tästä.
Kiinnostuitko? Mahtavaa!
 Lähetä meille hakemuksesi palkkatoivomuksineen viimeistään 22.10.2023. Toivomme kuulevamme sinusta mahdollisimman pian, sillä paikka täytetään heti sopivan henkilön löydyttyä.
Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa Competence Team Manager Laura Rapeli (puh 040 558 8031). Soittamalla saat minut parhaiten kiinni tiistaina 10.10. klo 10–15 ja maanantaina 16.10. klo 9–11. Voit myös jättää hakuaikana minulle soittopyynnön tekstiviestillä, joten soitan sinulle sopivassa hetkessä takaisin.
Tehtävään valittavalta henkilölle teetetään huumausainetesti ja voidaan teettää perusmuotoinen, turvallisuusselvityslain (726/2014) mukainen turvallisuusselvitys.

job_title: Azure Data Architect & Azure Data Engineer
raw_text:
A Microsoft partner company is looking for experienced and technical Azure Data professionals to join their team of talented individuals, and join ongoing projects.
Skills & Qualifications
 Must be Finnish speaking
 Azure, Data Architecture, Data Platform, Data Warehousing, Data Engineering, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL, Strong ETL Knowledge, Power BI Reporting experience desired.
 The client are looking for hands-on professionals.
Benefits
 Paid certifications
 Bonus
 Insurances & Health-care
 Vouchers
 Tailored development plans
If you - or anyone you know - is interested in these roles, get in touch!
Jack Allen (he/him)
Recruitment Consultant
Phone: +358 94 245 2358 (ext. 2358)
Email: j.allen@nigelfrank.com
Website: www.nigelfrank.com

Do you want to work within a strong internal culture that gives you limitless opportunities to grow as a professional and realize your own potential?
Our client is an innovative group of experts who offer you the opportunity to complete challenging and interesting assignments utilising the latest Azure technology with colleagues who are amongst the top in the industry.
Our client focuses solely on Azure Data Warehousing/Analytics, as well as Azure Integrations, working on fascinating large projects in the private sector. Employees are always working in teams in an open and friendly environment that offers flexible working options.
Responsibilities:
 Work Full-stack with Azure technologies such as Power BI and Azure Data Factory.
 Design, implement and improve the client's data analytics solutions for their customers.
 You are involved in the whole process of projects from the design stage to the implementation stage.
 You work as part of a team building modern data platforms and data pipes in Microsoft Azure cloud environments.
What they are looking for:
 You have a few years of experience in data warehousing (e.g. ETL) or integrations, and especially in Microsoft SQL Server databases.
 In addition to technical skills, the clients expects you to have experience in teamwork in the customer interface and the ability to promote development work independently.
 They value the experience of Azure, Microsoft on-premises analytics solutions and Master Data Management,
 The desire to learn and develop into a top-class Azure expert.
 Fluency in Finnish & English
What they offer:
 Excellent salary & benefits package
 They have built a quality senior team, sourcing only the best talent across Finland to ensure a high quality output
 Always work in project teams, no fire fighting
 Completely Azure based projects in the private sector
 Outsourced boring maintenance work to ensure colleagues work on only the most interesting and effective tasks
Salary: 4500-8500EUR for the right candidate
Whilst this position offers remote working all candidates must be located inside Finland with a valid work Visa.
All interviews will be carried out remotely.

I'm collaborating with a rapidly burgeoning enterprise, currently boasting a workforce of approximately 60 individuals, and poised for an ambitious expansion by 90 more within the next five years. Nestled in the heart of Helsinki, this company is an exclusive player in the domains of Azure Data Warehousing/Analytics and seamless Azure integrations.
At present, they're on the lookout for seasoned Senior Azure Data Engineers/Architects to join their accomplished and senior team. This seasoned team is deeply entrenched in managing substantial, exhilarating projects within the private sector.
No maintenance tasks, outsourced to pave the way for their in-house experts to focus exclusively on pivotal, meaningful undertakings. This company maintains an esteemed partnership with Microsoft, often called upon as a trusted ally.
Role and Responsibilities:
 Exercise a Full-stack approach, employing a gamut of Azure technologies encompassing Power BI and Azure Data Factory.
 Conceive, actualize, and refine sophisticated data analytics solutions for the clients.
 Engage comprehensively in project lifecycles, right from the initial design phase through to full-fledged implementation.
 Collaborate harmoniously in a team setting, architecting modern data platforms and pipelines within the expansive expanse of Microsoft Azure's cloud ecosystem.
Prerequisites:
 Demonstrated expertise spanning multiple years in data warehousing, inclusive of ETL proficiency and integrations, with a pronounced focus on Microsoft SQL Server databases.
 In addition to technical prowess, adeptness in client-oriented teamwork is anticipated, complemented by the ability to independently spearhead developmental initiatives.
 Deep-seated appreciation for Azure experience, coupled with a nuanced grasp of Microsoft on-premises analytics solutions and the subtleties of Master Data Management.
 An innate passion for continuous learning and the aspiration to ascend the ranks to become a distinguished Azure authority.
 Proficiency in both the Finnish and English languages.
Rewards:
 A compelling package comprising competitive remuneration and a comprehensive benefits suite.
 An team of top-tier senior professionals, meticulously curated to ensure the infusion of Finland's finest talents and guarantee outstanding output.
 Uninterrupted engagement with project teams, devoid of the disruptions associated with reactive troubleshooting.
 An exclusive portfolio of Azure-centric endeavors entrenched within the private sector.
 Mundane maintenance work has been judiciously outsourced, enabling colleagues to focus their energies exclusively on tasks of great import and efficacy.
For further insights, kindly submit your CV and contact particulars to:
Max William Bright Email: m.bright@nigelfrank.com Phone: +358942452104 LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/max-bright-646457186/
While remote work flexibility is part of the equation, it is essential that all candidates are situated within the geographical confines of Finland and hold a valid work Visa.
All interview processes will be meticulously conducted in a remote fashion.

Are you a talented Data Engineer or Data Architect seeking a new adventure in the dynamic world of data-driven solutions? We are thrilled to present you with an incredible opportunity to join a prestigious team and work on groundbreaking projects that will redefine the future of data technology.
🔑 Key Responsibilities: As a core member of our dynamic team, you will be tasked with:
 Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and architect robust solutions using Microsoft Azure technologies.
 Designing and developing scalable, performant, and secure data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
 Leveraging Azure Synapse Analytics for big data processing and warehousing.
 Ensuring data quality and consistency while adhering to best practices in data governance.
 Utilizing Azure SQL Database, Cosmos DB, or other data stores to manage structured and unstructured data.
 Mentoring and guiding junior team members to foster a culture of continuous learning and growth.
💼 Desired Skills and Experience: To excel in this role, you should possess:
 A strong background in Data Engineering, Data Architecture, or related fields with a specific focus on the Microsoft tech stack.
 Proficiency in coding with languages like Python, C#, or Scala for data manipulation and analysis within the Microsoft ecosystem.
 Hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and Synapse Analytics for building scalable data solutions.
 Knowledge of Azure SQL Database, Cosmos DB, or other Azure data storage services.
 Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and data modelling techniques.
 Excellent communication skills to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
🌟 Why Choose Us:
Join a company that is at the forefront of Microsoft technology adoption and values its employees' growth. As a Microsoft tech-focused organization, we provide unparalleled opportunities to work on innovative projects, while also supporting your professional development journey.
Benefits:
This is an amazing opportunity to receive of the line professional development, while earning a competitive salary. You will be working amongst talented professionals on exciting projects.
This role offers Insurances, Health-care, Food/Culture/Sport/Travel vouchers, PC Equipment, Allowances, Company shares and more!
Don't be the one to miss out, and get in touch today!
