u-blox (SIX:UBXN) is a global technology leader in positioning and wireless communication in automotive, industrial, and consumer markets. Their smart and reliable solutions, services and products let people, vehicles, and machines determine their precise position and communicate wirelessly over cellular and short range networks. With a broad portfolio of chips, modules, and secure data services and connectivity, u blox is uniquely positioned to empower its customers to develop innovative and reliable solutions for the Internet of Things, quickly and cost effectively. With headquarters in Thalwil, Switzerland, the company is globally present with offices in Europe, Asia, and the USA. (www.u-blox.com)
As GNSS Software Engineer you are part of our international team of specialized software engineers developing u-blox’s cutting edge GNSS technology. In this role you are responsible for developing and testing the Positioning Engine - at the heart of u-blox’ positioning products.
As developer in one of our agile multi-site Scrum teams, you actively contribute to the development and maintenance of our embedded navigation algorithms. Together with your team, you are responsible for the entire SW development process, from writing and discussing requirements to implementation, testing and verification. You collaborate with other software, hardware and product development teams to ensure high quality of the Positioning Engine software component.
You are an active team player with excellent communication skills? You have a sense of quality standards and a passion for professional coding? Join our team and benefit from knowledge transfer across the teams and organisation and potentially grow into your role with increasing responsibilities!
Your Responsibilities
 Navigation algorithm design, implementation and maintenance
 Test design, development and execution
 Requirements management
 Validation and error analysis
 Preparation of technical documentation
 Work package breakdown and estimation
 Providing workarounds or fixes for bugs and nonconformities
Your Skills and Experience
 PhD or MSc in geodesy, geomatics, computer science, engineering or a related field
 Good C/C++ development skills
 Flexible team player
 Good communication skills (oral and in writing) in English
Bonus Points
 GNSS
 Python
 GIT
 Statistics and adjustment theory
 Kalman Filter
 Mathematical and physical models
 Embedded software development
 ARM CPUs (CortexM)
 Robot Framework
What are your perks?
A multicultural and international company with over 60 different nationalities 
Project-based activities working with colleagues across the globe 
A start-up and innovation mindset while in the process of scaling-up processes and efficiencies 
Hybrid working model & flexible working hours 
A strong learning environment and regular career discussions 
Bonus and Company long-term incentive plan.
Good social benefits in each location
Sport activities and Team events.
… and discover even more by talking with us!
We see diversity as a strength and promote a culture of inclusion among our employees. Our varied backgrounds, ideas and experiences are critical to our success. We strive to become a strong learning organization and are committed to provide our employees with equal opportunities regardless of differences such as gender, race, ethnicity, generations, belief.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our team. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining high-quality software solutions that meet our customers' needs. Your role will require strong technical skills, as well as excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Key Responsibilities:
Design and develop complex software solutions using NodeJS, TypeScript, and AWS.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product owners, designers, and other engineers to build software products that meet customer needs.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code while ensuring software quality and scalability.
Implement automated testing strategies to ensure that our codebase is stable and reliable.
Work with GitLab CI to automate software delivery processes.
Use Terraform to build and maintain infrastructure as code.
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to other team members.
Stay up-to-date with new technologies and industry trends and evaluate their potential benefits to our software solutions.
Requirements:
Strong proficiency in NodeJS and TypeScript.
Experience with Cloud service providers and IaC.
Experience with CI/CD for continuous integration and delivery.
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
Excellent teamwork and communication skills.
If you are a motivated, self-starter who enjoys working in a fast-paced
environment with other highly skilled professionals, we encourage you to
apply for this position.

This role is available through Jefferson Frank, an international agency that has grown to be one of the trusted recruitment partners to businesses across Finland in different industries and domains. To learn more about this opportunity, reach out to George Paxton on LinkedIn who is responsible for this advert.
Company Details
Jefferson Frank are partnering with a leading & specialist Identity Access Management enterprise based in Helsinki. They provide a comprehensive Customer Identity Access Management solution in addition to a Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) platform to manage the digital identities of Customers, Workforce and Organisations. They're the largest accredited issuer globally and has issued verified identities to 200'000+ organisations internationally.
They have a diverse client base working with a variety of Enterprises, Banks, Fintech/Regtech intermediaries and Government entities for both internal and client usage of digital identity and legal entity regulatory requirements. They are currently actioning a long-term strategic growth plan which include scaling their engineering team working on their SaaS solution.
The role
In this position the chosen candidate would join as a Senior Software Engineer to their growing engineering department. The company already employs over 50 people across the Nordics (Finland & Sweden) in addition to resources setup within the UK.
You'd be working in a product development environment where your primary responsible would include defining the current and future architecture systems in addition to writing well designed, testable and efficient code across the Frontend, Backend and AWS-based infrastructure. In addition to this you will troubleshoot design flaws and system bottleneck which relates to AWS & DevOps tools and contribute to ALL phases of the development lifecycle within agile development teams.
Coming into the team as an experienced head, you'll be given the ability to share your knowledge and provide alternative solutions to key challenges faced from BOTH a development AND operations perspective with the end goal of seamless functionality of the platform.
The existing team takes an 'Automate at every opportunity' approach which you will embody. You'll play a part in deploying, operating and upgrading their Identity Cloud production instances for customers, improve, measure and monitor AWS deployments from development to production, monitor cloud costs, resolve customer/integrator issues for both on-site and in-house installations and participate in software development activities.
What they're looking for?
 Minimum 3+ years JavaScript development experience coming from previous roles working with a combination of traditional programming and DevOps toolings/processes.
 Familiarity with cloud networks (AWS), managing infrastructures and improving reliability standards.
 Experience managing containerised solutions with Kubernetes and/or ECS.
Beneficial if you have
 Experience with Protocols/Solutions such as OpenID Connect, OAuth2, SAML2 or on SSO systems.
 Prior identity access management experience.
Next steps
If you're looking to be immersed in a modern product development environment OR looking to move into an IAM space, this opportunity could be for you.
In addition to the salary + compensation package they also provide an additional benefits plus package as well as a hardware allowance with a choice from Mac, Linux or Windows PC. From a technical development perspective you'd be working in an open environment where innovation, learning and actions are encouraged. Furthermore, you'd be encouraged to take part in development day, an incentive to self focus time which allows you to prioritise your skills development in an area of your choice.
If you're considering taking that next step for this opportunity or simply want to learn more about this company or others that Jefferson Frank is actively working in Finland. Submit your CV via this job portal or reach out to George Paxton on LinkedIn.

This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and OpenStack. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
As a software engineer on the OpenStack Engineering team, you'll be building Charmed OpenStack and Ceph, a suite of open source Python based charms for deploying and managing OpenStack and Ceph. Your work will bring cloud platform technologies to a wide range of users and computing environments, from desktops to bare metal servers. This role requires a python software developer with a passion for automating infrastructure as code.
Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of the dynamics of the open source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.
This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week at a time.
What You'll Do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality code to create new features
Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
Review code produced by other engineers
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Ensure the success of OpenStack and Ceph on multiple architectures
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Who You Are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have experience with Python
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following:Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, AI/ML, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, C, Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, scalable web services
You have experience with non-x86 architectures, including s390, arm64, power and others
You have experience with OpenStack, OVN, Openvswitch and other related cloud technologies
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.
Keywords: python, agile, lean, distributed systems, openstack, ceph, containers, kubernetes, docker, scale-out, orchestration, linux, ubuntu, cloud, devops, open source, serverless, networking, home, remote job, software development, software engineering, openstack
Reports to: OpenStack Product Engineering Manager
Job location: Remote, home-based, Americas

The role
Our Workplace Engineering team are a highly performant group which specialises in web architecture and analytics specialists. Building new tools, dashboards and analytics that empower colleagues, managers and executives to make better decisions and deliver better work.
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneer in the digital workplace, established in 2004 with a global, remote-first policy that has delivered world-class open source and sets the pace in cloud, developer and IoT technology.
We are dedicated to continually improving to keep Canonical the best at remote work. It's part of our enjoyment of our mission - both to deliver the world's best free software, and to push the boundaries of 21st-century work and collaboration.
Our goal is to improve the state of the art even further in key business processes for a distributed team: hiring, collaboration, communication, learning, documentation, development, and open source development. We want to understand our distributed teams as well as we could understand co-located teams. We want to help them work better, be happier, and make better decisions.
What you will do:
Design and deliver web-based systems and SAAS
Provide new insights into the Canonical workplace experience
Enable new processes and improve existing workflows
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high-quality code to create new features
Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
Consistently provide high-quality code reviews to other engineers
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Estimate work, set goals and meet them
Write project specifications, and epics and understand the risks
Understand completion criteria and push work to completion
Coaching, mentoring and providing feedback to more junior members of the team, while always developing yourself
Connect to many data sources and provide insightful visualisations
Database design and architecture for connected systems
Developing new and improved working practices for the company
Providing tooling to support optimised processes
Love what you do. 
Who You Are
To be successful in this team you must be an expert in two or more of the following:
Backend web service programming in Python and Node.JS
Solid understanding of web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. 
Data analytics and statistical analysis
Natural language processing, sentiment analysis, machine learning
Data visualisation
The ideal candidate will use their passion for experimentation and analytics to build tomorrow's tech organisation. This team will help us gain insights into the business and our talent pool, and use those insights to improve the experience of working at Canonical.
As a Senior Web Engineer at Canonical, you need an analytical, data-driven mind and a passion to connect and make sense of interesting data from APIs. We focus heavily on the collection of metrics, optimising processes, and ways of working across Canonical. You need to demonstrate leadership, excellence, and consistency and will mentor others in the team.
We offer
Remote first: 100% remote working with the opportunity to travel to Sprints. We meet a couple of times a year in interesting places all around the world to come together to collaborate. These Sprints see circa 300 people come together. This year we have travelled to Frankfurt, Copenhagen, Montreal and Prague!
Personal development: Annual budget allowance and time to focus on areas you want to improve. 
Compensation: eligibility for annual pay review including bonuses. 
Recognition: The ability to possibly be rewarded and recognised by others for the work you do. 
Travel: Priority Pass for lounge access when flying to sprints. International SOS membership to support you whilst travelling. 
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

M
ake Impossible Possible in New Space - Join ICEYE
Location: Finland
Hiring Model: Office
Who are we?
We are a Finnish-based international Aerospace company with employees from over 57 countries in Finland, the US, the UK, Spain, Luxembourg, and Poland. Our team is a tight-knit group of experts from areas including engineering, software development, and radar technology. We're innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. As advocates of our corporate culture, we value teamwork and curiosity and know how to have fun!
What do you think we should do?
ICEYE is building and operating its commercial constellation of small Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites with SAR data available to customers. Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time - even when it's cloudy or dark - providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.
What are we looking for?
We seek a Senior Flight Dynamics Engineer to join ICEYE to support the company's growth. You will be a part of a small, dedicated team facing an exciting challenge. We design, manufacture, and operate a constellation of propulsion-capable spacecraft, allowing you to work on cutting-edge astrodynamics and propulsion technology. You will get to work with world-leading space engineers and a project that has a real impact. You will enjoy a transparent, open, and inclusive work culture.
What you will do:
Developing, testing, and maintaining orbit control and orbit determination software
Analyzing performance and anomalies for in-lab and on-orbit thrusters
Supporting launches and on-orbit propulsion system commissioning
Supporting other ICEYE teams with Flight Dynamics domain knowledge
Requirements
Must have:
Degree in Physics, Aerospace, Engineering, Mathematics or similar
5+ years of experience working on orbit control or orbit determination problems
At least five years of experience in software engineering
Experience with Python and common scientific/engineering modules
Strong general problem-solving and analytical skills
Collaborative, team-oriented mindset
Ability to explain technical concepts clearly and concisely
Preferred to have:
Experience with STK or ODTK
Experience designing or operating electrical propulsion systems
Experience in assembly, integration, and test of spacecraft hardware
Benefits
A job that matters in a dynamic New Space environment with a scale-up approach
An independent role with a supportive and diverse work environment
Time for self-development, research, training, conferences, or certification schemes
A yearly benefit budget to spend as you wish (ie, Auntie, language learning, coaching, budget for additional work equipment for home, charity activity)
Diversity& inclusion are core values at ICEYE. We are passionate about building and sustaining inclusive and equitable working and learning environments for all staff. We believe every team member enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and discover, design, and deliver solutions.
Could this be the role for you? You can apply to start your journey with ICEYE.
We are making the impossible possible together.
Contact
Riya Vidhani

Our Managed Identity Access Management (MIAM) team is now looking for a Software Engineer to our Identity & Access Management (IAM) Solutions Business Area. You have the following

job_title: SENIOR/PRINCIPAL SOFTWARE ENGINEER (Embedded Systems & Indoor Positioning)
raw_text:
Exafore is a privately owned Finnish technology company specializing in location technology solutions and services. The company was established in 2015 and today we have a growing multinational team of 30 Exaforeans. What makes us unique is that we have lots of different customer projects, but we are also developing Exafore Horizon, our indoor positioning system product. 
We are looking for a SENIOR/PRINCIPAL SOFTWARE ENGINEER to join our indoor positioning system product development team. In this role, you will get lots of responsibility for the development work of the embedded SW components of the system. 
Our office is in Hervanta/Hermia area in Tampere. Part of the work can be done remotely but usually your presence at the office is needed almost daily.
EXAFORE HORIZON – OUR INDOOR POSITIONING SYSTEM PRODUCT
⚫ An ultra-wideband (UWB) radio technology based real time system that measures the distances between base stations and tags. The system can report 3D tag locations with an accuracy of 10 cm.
⚫ Embedded components are implemented in C and server components in Python.
⚫ The system also includes an Android application written in Java/Kotlin. The application is used mainly as an installation tool when the system is installed in new indoor locations but also for customer demos and product testing.
⚫ The product was launched at the beginning of 2020. In the near future we focus on automating the installation process further. Exafore Horizon development team’s size usually varies between 5 to 10 Exaforeans depending on the customer project situation.
⚫ Please check our website (https://www.exafore.com/accurate-indoor-positioning) for more information about Exafore Horizon.
 
YOUR ROLE AS A SENIOR/PRINCIPAL SOFTWARE ENGINEER
Your Exafore journey starts by working in one of the key roles of Exafore Horizon product development team. As a Senior/Principal Software Engineer, you will take a big responsibility in base station and tag related development work with C language. You will also take lots of responsibility in decision making related to the embedded SW components of the system. In this role, you will learn new things about positioning and have lots of chances to contribute to the specification, software design, implementations and testing of new features of our indoor positioning system product.
Buzzwords related to your role:
C language, ARM, Meson, GitHub, Jenkins, Wireless Communication, MAC, Interfaces, Indoor Positioning, Product Development
Examples of the areas you will work in:
🟣 Designing and implementing system self-configuration features
🟣 Designing and writing effective interfaces for data communication between server, base stations and tags
🟣 Writing and optimizing code for tight timing requirements in wireless communication
🟣 Using HW resources effectively to keep minimal power consumption in mind for battery powered devices
🟣 Architectural design and improvements using modularization and proper internal interfaces
🟣 Contributing to higher level system design and development from embedded devices perspective
🟣 Driving and maintaining good code development practices
EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS WE ARE LOOKING FOR
⚫ Earlier experience (5+ years) in resource restricted embedded systems environment, firmware development and RTOSes
⚫ Experience in architectural designs and understanding of complex systems
⚫ Solid programming skills in C language 
⚫ Experience in software development processes and practices e.g. code reviews, unit tests and version control
⚫ Good communication skills in English
WHAT CAN EXAFORE OFFER YOU?
Please have a look at our career pages (https://careers.exafore.com) to get a better view of our team and what is it like to work at Exafore. Here is also a short summary of the things we can offer you.
🟣 
Flexible and caring organizational culture in a privately owned Finnish technology company:
 We are a very professional yet relaxed multinational work community with a flat hierarchy and a good atmosphere
🟣 
Great work-life balance:
 Flexible working hours and opportunity to work partly remotely (depending on the devices you need etc.)
🟣 
Wide career opportunities:
 Opportunities to learn new things about location technologies and embedded systems by working on meaningful and professionally challenging projects (own product development and long-term customer projects)
🟣 
Fair annual leave policy:
 2.5 days annual leave accrual per month from the beginning of employment and lots of flexibility to arrange your leaves
🟣 
Extended healthcare services
🟣 
Dental services
🟣 
Lunch benefit and snacks at the office
🟣 
Exercise and culture benefit and/or massage benefit
🟣 
A membership to Hermia gym
🟣 
A possibility to arrange and participate in different team activities supported by Exafore
🟣 
Fair compensation for your work:
 The salaries that we pay to our employees are above the software industry average in Finland
HOW CAN YOU JOIN OUR TEAM?
You can apply for the position by LinkedIn Easy Apply function or approach us through our easy-to-use recruitment system on our career pages.
Our People & Culture Specialist Rita Raittila (rita.raittila@exafore.com, 050 330 7543) is happy to answer any questions you might have about our recruitment process or working at Exafore in general. In case you have more technical questions, you can reach out to our Director of Business Development Ilkka Saastamoinen (ilkka.saastamoinen@exafore.com).
We look forward to hearing from you!

Blueprint Genetics, a Quest Diagnostics company, is a leading clinical genetic testing company aspiring to bring world-class genetic knowledge to mainstream healthcare. We are strengthening the core of our diagnostics where we utilize Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) technologies, which produce large quantities of data, requiring highly efficient computing infrastructure and data analysis pipelines. To support our production bioinformatics work and constant strive for state-of-the-art analytic solutions, we are looking for a 
Clinical Bioinformatics Engineer
 to join our Clinical Bioinformatics team in Espoo, Finland.
Job Description
In this position, you are one of the NGS data experts of the company. You work in a versatile role in the cross-section of our Bioinformatics, Interpretation, Lab R&D, Cloud and Software Development teams locally and globally. Your main tasks will include:
Taking deep dives into the NGS data of patients to help our geneticists to solve bioinformatically challenging patient cases.
Executing a software maintenance process compliant with software as medical device standards including support, life cycle management and feature development of core bioinformatics software and supporting software.
Participating in assay and software validations and related documentation process and software release process in the scope of maintenance updates.
You are involved in development and testing of new laboratory assays and perform bioinformatic analyses in custom research projects with our customers.
What We Expect From You
We are looking for a motivated and quality-driven person who finds fulfillment in continuous improvement. We aspire to find a colleague who is eager to learn and grow with us, and fits our easy-going team of skilled and knowledgeable professionals. Our ideal candidate would have:
An MSc or PhD degree in Bioinformatics or related field
A minimum of 2 years of experience working as a bioinformatician or in a similar role with NGS data analysis experience
Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English
Strong teamwork skills and the motivation to learn from others
What Differentiates You
Expertise in bioinformatics including large scale bioinformatic workloads, workflow management languages, large scale NGS data management and AWS cloud
Experience in large scale batch job analyses and related data management challenges
Experience with software maintenance processes
Knowledge of Medical Device regulation and developing Medical Device software
What We Offer
The opportunity to work for a company that makes a real difference – Blueprint Genetics has a clear and motivating purpose to improve the lives of patients and families affected by inherited diseases
A positive and international work environment with great people from different fields of expertise. We are a team of close to 300 experienced professionals, who collaborate to drive genetic knowledge forward
Employee benefits such as participation in performance-based bonus payment system, extensive occupational healthcare with Heltti, sports, culture & wellbeing benefit, team events & office parties
Hybrid work – we like to see each other at the office from time to time, but offer an opportunity to work remotely as well
How To Apply
Does this sound like your next career move? All you need to do is submit your CV or share your LinkedIn profile with us through our online form at the latest on October 20. The first round of discussions will be carried out virtually. We hope to hear from you soon!
This is a permanent, full-time role, located in our Keilaniemi, Espoo office. If you have any further questions about the position, you can contact our Clinical Bioinformatics Manager Mikko Muona, mikko.muona@blueprintgenetics.com
Who We Are
We are a specialty genetics and bioinformatics company focused on providing genetic testing for inherited diseases. We are based in Helsinki, with a customer base spanning over 70 countries. www.blueprintgenetics.com
Blueprint Genetics is a Quest Diagnostics company. Quest Diagnostics is the world’s leading provider of diagnostic information services. www.questdiagnostics.com
We are changing diagnostics by providing accessible and actionable genetic knowledge in all medical specialties. Our mission is to support healthcare professionals around the world in providing the  best care for patients and families  with rare inherited diseases. We do that by delivering answers using fast, affordable, and comprehensive genetic diagnostics.

Redefine the Linux experience in the embedded environments with the smallest, most secure, and updatable operating system in the IoT market. This is an opportunity for a senior software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, security, and the developer experience. This challenging role demands a high degree of technical skill with low-level operating systems, kernel, and device firmware.
Our mission is to allow everyone to build robust solutions in various fields including but not limited to IoT, automotive, and aviation using the next generation secure embedded Linux operating system in a simple solution. We define a reliable and secure set of device recovery mechanisms that enable device manufacturers to simplify and standardise the field operations for fleets of heterogeneous appliances.
As a senior team member, you'll be designing and implementing software that runs on various CPU architectures, such as ARM, RISC-V, and X86. You will work on boot mechanisms, bootloaders, storage partition layout, device trees, kernel, services, and userspace applications to manage the system via RESTful APIs.
Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
What you'll do
Develop system daemons with REST APIs in Golang
Integrate diverse bootloaders and maintain gadget snaps
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality code with unit tests to create new features
Debug issues and produce high quality fixes
Review code produced by other engineers
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 times a year for internal and external events
Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have experience with Golang, C/C++, and Shell
You have a solid understanding of Linux and a modern GNU/Linux distribution, Debian or Ubuntu preferred
You have experience or interest in low-level system and security facilities such as:
Bootloaders in ARM and X86, such as piboot, uboot, grub-uefi
Systemd and units, udev, initrd, graphics
OS level firmware daemons and CLI applications
Linux security implementations - TPM, FDE, LUKS, HSM, etc. 
You have experience with API design and development - REST/gRPC or similar
You have personal or professional experience with Linux-capable devices such as Raspberry Pi
What is Canonical?
Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
#stack

Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to provide multi-cloud and on-premise data solutions for the enterprise. The data platform team is a collaborative team that develops a full range of data stores and data technologies, spanning from big data, through NoSQL, cache-layer capabilities, and analytics; all the way to structured SQL engines.
The OpenSearch team is, among other things, focused on creating the best enterprise automation solution for search and analytics suites like OpenSearch and Elasticsearch.
We have a number of openings we are looking to hire across a range of levels. We will help you identify a suitable position depending on your experience and interests. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open-source community dynamics and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organisations.
Location: This is a Globally remote role
What your day will look like
The OpenSearch team is responsible for the automation of OpenSearch operations. This includes ensuring fault-tolerant replication, TLS, installation, and much more; but also provides domain-specific expertise on the actual data system to other teams within Canonical. This role is focused on the creation and automation of features of data platforms, not analysing the data in them.
Collaborate proactively with an internationally distributed team
Write high-quality, idiomatic Python code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with upstream communities publicly
Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in a diverse set of fields
Work from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events
What we are looking for in you
Proven hands-on experience in software development using Python
Proven hands-on experience in distributed systems development
Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM, or a similar degree
Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events
Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring
You might also bring a subset of experience from the following, which will determine the exact role and level we consider you for:
Experience operating and managing search and analytics engines like Elasticsearch, Logstash, KIbana, and OpenSearch
Experience with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
Experience with the public cloud or a private cloud solution like OpenStack
Experience with operating Kubernetes clusters and a belief that it can be used for serious persistent data services
What we offer you
Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal-opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Helsinki - Hybrid Remote
raw_text:
Overview
 Our Client's global mission is to help enterprises embrace the global digital identity ecosystem, improve operational effectiveness and build trusted business relationships.
 Our Client is a Europe-based Identity Services specialist and offers a comprehensive CIAM (Customer Identity & Access Management) & LEI (Legal Entity Identifier) platform to manage the digital identities of customers, workforce and organisations.
 Through their RapidLEI service, the company is the largest accredited LEI issuer globally and has issued verified organisation identities to over 200,000 organisations.
Industry
 Our Client works with enterprises, banks, fintech/regtech, and Government for internal and client use of digital identity in digital identity management, KYC/KYB, and legal entity regulatory requirements
Team Structure
 Headcount: Total 60 people (30 Finland, 25 UK, 5 Sweden.)
 Two Engineering teams working on separate projects (6 tech professionals)
 Four person's operations team
Future Growth Plans
 Strong plans to scale their Engineering team working on the SaaS product.
Career Progression
 Career progression for a Lead Engineer when the organisation scales for (5 engineers would be beneath you) leading 1-1 talks and operational responsibilities.
Role Overview
Senior Software Engineer:
Our Client is looking for a seasoned and skilled hands-on Senior Software Engineer with passion to deliver high quality software to join their product development team in Finland. We expect you to have a long and solid background developing scalable web applications using modern, agile methods and the ability to provide input to every phase during the software life-cycle.
You have the ability to move things forward and share your knowledge to the rest of the team. It is essential that we work as a solid team solving problems together and sharing information. You understand that all projects need to work together to make a seamless platform.
We encourage people to continuously learn; We have a recurring Development day - self focus time which permit you to familiarize to whatever you feel helps you to succeed in your daily work.
Their core focus is Customer Identity and Access Management, thus they consider it as a plus if you have worked with some protocols and solutions like OpenID Connect, OAuth2, SAML2 or on SSO systems.
Must
> Past 5-10 years working in demanding web application projects
> 2-5 years in Senior position working with cloud-native application development (AWS)
Senior Software Engineer: (React, Next.js, TypeScript, REST APIs, CI/CD, IaC, AWS.)
Responsibility
 Examining and defining current and future architecture systems
 Designing scalable architecture systems for cloud native applications
 Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle in Agile development teams
 Write well designed, testable, efficient code for frontend, backend and infrastructure
 Prepare and produce releases of software components
 Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review
 Troubleshooting design flaws and system bottlenecks, also related to AWS and DevOps tools
Keywords: Typescript, React, NextJS, NestJS, HTML, CSS, Linux containers, Kubernetes, Docker, Podman, microservices, REST APIs, GraphQL, Yarn, Git, Github, CI, CD, IaC, Terraform, Pulumi, Linux, AWS.
All AWS experience is massively helpful - the more certificates the better.
 Open environment where innovation, learning and actions are encouraged.
 Super-exciting new development projects without legacy components holding you back.
 Close knit team of intelligent colleagues working to solve complex problems together.
 Competitive salary with additional benefits, plus ability to benefit from the success of the company.
 Freedom to choose your tools - macOS, Linux, Windows, whichever works for you.
 They have 4 unique and highly specialised Products within the IAM and ISaaS space.
Alongside the above, prescreening questions will be sent out ahead of an initial qualifying call.

Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to provide multi-cloud and on-premise data solutions for the enterprise. The data platform team is a collaborative team that develops a managed solutions for a full range of data stores and data technologies, spanning from big data, through NoSQL, cache-layer capabilities, and analytics; all the way to structured SQL engines (similar to Amazon RDS approach).
We are facing the interesting problem of fault-tolerant mission-critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering managed data platforms.
We are looking for candidates from junior to senior level with interests, experience and willingness to learn around Big Data technologies, such as distributed event-stores (Kafka) and parallel computing frameworks (Spark). Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open-source community dynamics and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organisations.
Location: This is a Globally remote role
What your day will look like
The data platform team is responsible for the automation of data platform operations, with the mission of managing and integrating Big Data platforms at scale. This includes ensuring fault-tolerant replication, TLS, installation, backups and much more; but also provides domain-specific expertise on the actual data system to other teams within Canonical. This role is focused on the creation and automation of infrastructure features of data platforms, not analysing and/or processing the data in them.
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high-quality, idiomatic Python code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with upstream communities publicly
Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Work from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events
What we are looking for in you
Proven hands-on experience in software development using Python
Proven hands-on experience in distributed systems, such as Kafka and Spark
Have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM, or a similar degree
Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events
Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring
You might also bring a subset of experience from the followings that can help Data Platform to achieve its challenging goals and determine the level we will consider you for:
Experience operating and managing other data platform technologies, SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc) and/or NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis, ElasticSearch, etc), similar to DBA level expertise
Experience with Linux systems administration, package management, and infrastructure operations
Experience with the public cloud or a private cloud solution like OpenStack
Experience with operating Kubernetes clusters and a belief that it can be used for serious persistent data services
What we offer you
Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Parental Leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues twice a year
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal-opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Primary location:
HELSINKI
S Group is the biggest private employer and nowadays also a significant digital employer in Finland. In recent years, we’ve made great investments in digitalizing S Group’s services and tools both for our customers and employees. We are a market leader in grocery eCom and a development hub for several of the most used web services and mobile apps in Finland. This has required raising our internal software engineering maturity and capabilities and maturity as a digital employer. The guiding lights of our digital product and service development are data and customer insight. SOK already employs hundreds of digital talents, and now we’re ready to turn on the next gear: we are hiring 100 new digital talents to our community to join our journey from bricks to bits!
Mobile Engineers
As a Mobile Engineer at SOK, you will be designated for a specific cross-functional agile team focusing on developing their product/service. Together with your team members from the fields of coding, QA, DevOps, design, data&analytics and business, you share the E2E responsibility of your own product/service all the way from discovery phase to solution phase and further to coding, testing and maintenance and operations.
Your daily work consists of coding, naturally, and participating in the whole application development life cycle. Agility for us means culture rather than recurring calendar reservations alone, which means that we want to enable the teams to have freedom, responsibility and accountability of their own work. We work in a hybrid setting at least one office day per week at Ässäkeskus in Vallila, though some of us like to spend more time at the office.
Teams that are hiring
We are looking for mobile engineers to work with the following products and tech stack:
S-kaupat for grocery eCom
React Native, TypeScript, GraphQL, React, NextJS 
Restaurant Services
React Native, robust products, integrations, Android technologies 
What We Hope From You
Experience and skills in mobile engineering, and the tech stack we use (React Native for cross-platform; Swift for native iOS; Kotlin for Android)
Collaborative and communicative working style and team player mindset
In work related matters you work fluently in English
What We Offer For You
On top of a respectful salary, superb company benefits and the finest colleagues, this is what we offer in return:
An opportunity to improve and influence the daily lives of millions of people 
Stability and continuity. Being founded in 1904 and doing huge investments to digitalization, we make sure that we can provide affordable, high-quality products and services for our co-op members, regular Finnish consumers, also another +100 years from this day
Influence and responsibility. Our engineers have a lot of freedom in their work, but they also live with their solutions, and so do millions of users too 
Ownership. You’re creating services directly for the end-users, whether they’re customers or S Group employees. You’re not visiting a project; you own the product together with your team
Workplace democracy. Our ways of working are not set in stone. Together we continuously improve the ways of developing products and services in the biggest private employer in Finland.
Reasonable workload. Our supportive digital community with its great ways of working, setting realistic expectations and the possibility of hybrid work, all adds up to less stress for you
An opportunity to gain know-how and technical competence in wide-ranging technology domains (like web, mobile and cloud) as well as business sectors (restaurants, hotels, online retail and service stations)
Peer support and network of other (mobile) engineers. Our mobile engineering competence community offers a forum for discussing about the trends and innovations in the field with other bright-minded mobile engineering talents
Concrete and rewarding end-results, which you can experience yourself by using S Group’s services, when doing your grocery shopping, fueling or staying in a hotel, for example
Occupational healthcare, sports and culture benefit, lunch benefit in our staff restaurant
Access to the hobby and sports facilities and free parking in Ässäkeskus
Our Process
Please submit your CV in English here - application period is 27.9. -11.10.2023. We start going through applications as soon as they arrive, but we’ll be in touch with you a week after the application period ends at the latest. Once contact has been made, you will have the opportunity to ask what questions you may have about this job, our people, and what your future could look like at SOK.
Our interview process is both respectful and comprehensive. You’ll meet our recruiter, hiring manager and some of your teammates. We’ll be discussing technical things as well as softer skills, validating your technical expertise and performing a light talent assessment. The aim is to ensure we can offer what you’re looking for, and to make sure you're the right person for the job. Despite the outcome we strive to make the process a positive one.
If you are hired to the teams working with financial and banking solutions and sensitive data (S-Pankki and S-mobiili teams), we will check your credit history, corporate connections and make the security clearance.
Looking forward to meeting you!
#SOK #SOKDigitalTalent

At Rovio you will get to work with one of the most famous games IP’s in the world: Angry Birds. Our mission is to “craft joy” for the wide audience that we reach with our games and products. In order to do that, we know that people need to bring their own joy to what we do. That’s why we value work-life balance, say no to crunch culture, and welcome people from all walks of life to join the flock. Today, we are a proud team of 500+ caring and talented professionals representing 54 different nations.
We trust our teams to work autonomously by providing them the right tools and level of responsibility. We believe in our teams to remain creative and to keep learning – as well as ensuring everyone has opportunities for personal growth.
Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations. It is the job of Rovio data craft to turn that raw data into actionable insights for Rovio’s games teams and other business units. The data craft aims to empower Rovio’s teams with insightful data, and also with relevant tools and models that support decision making.
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who will be a main driver of Ads growth opportunities based on data insights.
You will have fun at work by doing:
Product/Roadmap Prioritization:
Develop in collaboration with the Ad’s team stakeholders, short to mid-term data project roadmap 
Define priorities and work allocation on weekly meetings with Ads Team
Reporting:
Building data pipelines and automated analyses using modern scripting methods
Building meaningful dashboards that answer business questions and improve decision making
Participate in data harmonisation processes by defining requirements, implementing ETL processes and ensuring data quality
Insights:
Own data-driven projects from ideation to execution and collaborate with business owners and analytics peers alike
Study changes in key metrics and long-term trends and forecasting 
Work with game teams to identify white space opportunities for Ads 
Superpowers and skills we are looking for:
Ability to turn analyses into purposeful action
Domain knowledge of Ads or Game analytics
Proficiency in Python or R
Understanding of advanced SQL
Excellent cooperation and communication skills
Interview process:
First meeting: You will meet the TA Partner to get acquainted and learn more about Rovio and the specifics of the role.
Call with a Hiring manager: You will catch up for a short call with your potential manager to dive deeper into your skills and also discuss what motivates you.
Test: a technical assignment that will take you no longer than 2 hours. 
Technical panel interview: You will meet some of teammates. Our aim is to get a clear overview of your hard skills and where we can help you develop.
Final meeting: You will have a chat with some team members and the relevant stakeholders from other teams. The goal is to discuss your career ambitions and expectations, and also how you would fit with our working culture.

NET SOFTWARE ENGINEER Sweden
A .NET Software Engineer will be responsible for design and development of back-end mission critical sportsbook trading systems. These systems make real-time trading decisions, reacting to wagers, game-state changes and trader input in real-time. Candidate will be actively involved in all phases of the software development life cycle including: requirements gathering, researching, initial configuration and set-up, design, documentation, testing, debugging, updates, ongoing support, integration, maintenance and troubleshooting. We maintain a fast-paced environment with constant iterations w/ stakeholders and almost daily production releases. A big focus is on overall design, flexibility and scalability of the system.
Knowledge & Experience
Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems.
2+ years of development using C#
Preferred experience of working in the sports betting industry and passion for sports in general
Preferred experience in designing and developing scalable and high performance distributed systems
Preferred Experience Of Working With Docker And Kubernetes (k8s)
Preferred experience with NOSQL (MongoDB, Redis) databases
Preferred Experience With RabbitMQ (RMQ)
Preferred experience of working in a CI / CD environment
Preferred Experience Working On High-consequence Production Systems
Preferred experience triaging production issues in complex systems
Skills & Qualifications
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail
Ability to multi-task and manage multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment
Strong ability to analyze business requirements and build according to business specifications
Initiative to work independently, but also able to work effectively with team members
Flexibility and adaptability to business requirements and priority changes
Fluent in English

Sasken Finland Oy serves domestic and global customers in design and development of hardware and software products and provides services for industries such as Telecommunication, Industrials and Defense, Medical, and Satcom. Sasken Finland has a strong track record of successfully delivering R&D product programs with a high-end expertise in wireless technologies.
 
We are now looking for a 
Senior Engineer Software
 and 
Engineer Software
 to join our team in the Tampere office!
 
We offer you an opportunity to serve our customers with interesting and meaningful software projects. 
 
You will be responsible for:
 
design, coding, testing, bug fixing, documentation and technical support in the assigned area.
on time delivery while adhering to quality and productivity goals.
adhering to guidelines and checklists for all deliverable reviews, sending status report to team lead and following relevant organizational processes.
for customer collaboration and interactions and support to customer queries. Expected to enhance technical capabilities by attending trainings, self-study and periodic technical assessments. Expected to participate in technical initiatives related to project and organization and deliver training as per plan and quality.
 
What you need to succeed
 
You have gained work experience to be able to apply knowledge effectively and deliver results. You are able to demonstrate the ability to analyse and interpret complex problems and improve change or adapt existing methods to solve the problem.
You regularly interact with interfacing groups / customer on technical issue clarification and resolves the issues. You participate actively in important project/ work related activities and contribute towards identifying important issues and risks. Reach out for guidance and advice to ensure high quality of deliverables.
You are consistently seeking opportunities to enhance existing skills, acquire more complex skills and work towards enhancing proficiency level in your field of specialisation.
Following skills are required:
C++, Objective-C
Lua, shell scripiting
Familiar with Linux, Unix or MacOS environment
Willingness to travel globally and work short times abroad, even some exotic places like Vietnam, Philippines, Malaysia, etc.
Senior level requires proven track record on daily working on multicultural environment and additionally understanding on production and device manufacturing, test automation for production and familiarity on factory environments.
Education and Experience Required
 
Engineering graduate, MCA, etc Experience: 2-5 years
 
For further information please contact Jani Turpeinen, Vice President Software via email jani.turpeinen@sasken.com.
 
Please submit your application by today as we follow Sasken Finland recruitment process and the interview process may begin before the closing of the job posting. 
 
Mandatory requirements: Finnish/EU citizenship and passport, English language.
 
Kindly note Sasken Finland does not provide relocation activities.

Job Title: Data Scientist
Location: Helsinki, Finland - on site expected 3-4 times per week in Salo or Helsinki
Company Overview
We are the go-to-partner for RFID based PaaS Applications across Europe and the Nordics, with deep roots in identification solutions.
Based in Finland and focusing on developing and delivering innovative Identification Solutions that utilize all of the latest RFID & IoT Technologies, all for real time item tracking. We serve customers across multiple industries.
We develop our own readers and software for complete solutions, and we can offer highly motivating career path for professionals passionate about identification technology. We are passionate to grow and bring a digital soul to every item.
Position Overview
As a Data Scientist you will be a key player in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive business growth. You will work in a collaborative, English-speaking environment where your skills in Python programming, AWS cloud or multi-cloud platforms, and artificial intelligence will be put to the test.
Key Responsibilities
 Apply your expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and AI to solve complex business problems.
 Develop predictive models, algorithms, and data-driven solutions.
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data requirements.
 Utilize Python programming to clean, manipulate, and visualize data effectively.
 Deploy and maintain machine learning models on cloud platforms (AWS or multi-cloud).
 Continuously explore new techniques and technologies to improve data analysis processes.
Qualifications
 2-4 years of proven experience as a Data Scientist in a professional setting.
 Strong proficiency in Python programming.
 Experience with AWS cloud services or multi-cloud platforms.
 Background or hands-on experience in artificial intelligence and machine learning.
 Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
 Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
What We Offer
 Competitive salary and benefits package.
 A dynamic and inclusive work environment.
 Opportunities for professional development and growth.
 The chance to work on exciting projects that make a real impact.
How To Apply
If you are excited about the opportunity to be part of a cutting-edge team and have the qualifications we are looking for, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience to s.cook1@jeffersonfrank.com
Please note, only applicants that are successful and that have been selected for an initial screening will be contacted.

Introduction
Our client is looking for a seasoned and skilled hands-on Senior Software Engineer with passion to deliver high quality software to join our product development team in Finland. We expect you to have a long and solid background developing scalable web applications using modern, agile methods and the ability to provide input to every phase during the software life-cycle.
You have the ability to move things forward and share your knowledge to the rest of the team. It is essential that we work as a solid team solving problems together and sharing information. You understand that all projects need to work together to make a seamless platform.
We encourage people to continously learn; We have a recurring Development day - self focus time which permit you to familiarize to whatever you feel helps you to succeed in your daily work
Their core focus is Customer Identity and Access Management, thus we consider it as a huge plus if you have worked with some modern protocols and solutions like OpenID Connect, OAuth2, Identity Management, SAML2 or on SSO systems. Knowledge on these technologies will help you quickly dive into the new software service that Ubisecure is building for its customers. However, we are sure that quick-learners will be able to get up to speed from the start!
They are an inclusive employer. We strongly encourage people of all backgrounds to apply to work with us, regardless of gender, race, sexual orientation/identity, religion, disability or other status.
What Will Be Your Responsibility
 Examining and defining current and future architecture systems
 Designing scalable architecture systems for cloud native applications
 Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle in Agile development teams
 Write well designed, testable, efficient code for frontend, backend and infrastructure
 Prepare and produce releases of software components
 Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review
 Troubleshooting design flaws and system bottlenecks, also related to AWS and DevOps tools
What We Offer
 Open environment where innovation, learning and actions are encouraged.
 Super-exciting new development projects without legacy components holding you back.
 Close knit team of intelligent colleagues working to solve complex problems together.
 Competitive salary with additional benefits, plus ability to benefit from the success of the company.
 Freedom to choose your tools - macOS, Linux, Windows, whichever works for you.
Minimum Requirements
 Past > 5-10 years working in demanding web application projects
 > 2-5 years in Senior position working with cloud-native application development
Keywords: Typescript, React, NextJS, NestJS, HTML, CSS, Linux containers, Kubernetes, Docker, Podman, microservices, REST APIs, GraphQL, Yarn, Git, Github, CI, CD, IaC, Terraform, Pulumi, Linux, AWS.
Start date: position is open now
This is a brief description of the role, for the full information, simply apply to the role and I will call you to discuss.
